decision_conditions: The 2no. high-level rear windows (i.e. labelled W1.01 and W1.02 on plan reference P203_Rev B) shall be wholly fitted with fully opaque black-out privacy film as per the approved "EvoWrap" manufacturer's specification details (set out in the agent's email dated 10 April 2024). These fittings shall be installed within 3 months of the date of this decision. The black-out film applied to the glazing of the 2no. rear windows would be retained for the lifetime of the development.
To prevent overlooking and light spill to adjacent properties in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, numbers P101 - Location Plan, P102 - Block Plan, P203_Rev B - Proposed Plans and Elevations.
To ensure the development complies with the provisions of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020), and the London Plan (2021).

The 2no. high-level rear windows (i.e. labelled W1.01 and W1.02 on plan reference P203_Rev B) and the 3no first floor windows in the side elevation facing south shall have a restricted opening system allowing a maximum opening of 5cm and be non opening below a height of 1.7m taken from internal finished floor level for so long as the development remains in existence.
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

The 3no first floor windows in the side elevation facing south shall be glazed with permanently obscured glass and non-opening below a height of 1.7 metres taken from internal finished floor level for so long as the development remains in existence.
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

The 2no. high-level rear windows (i.e. labelled W1.01 and W1.02 on plan reference P203_Rev B) and the associated black-out film to be installed on these windows shall match the colour of the exterior rear elevation of the existing building and shall thereafter be retained as such.
These changes shall be implemented within 3 months of the date of this decision.

To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to ensure that the proposed development does not have an adverse effect upon the appearance of the existing building in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020)
description: Replace existing rear windows with high level windows and insertion of 3no. side facing windows (Retrospective application)
